10.21.18  1:08 pm   I want to write music without learning music theory bc I think music theory will disrupt my songwriting flow by adding a certain bias to it. But my friend was trippin out like "you need to know music theory to be good" and now I'm like "aaaaaaaaaa." Because I don't want to corrupt my creative process but now I feel like I won't be able to do anything correctly. Thoughts?

10.20.18  8:23 pm   How do I know if the pulse of a song that I'm tapping my foot to is the quarter notes or the 8th notes?

      Sometimes I guess the tempo makes it an obvious choice, like if something is 60bpm it would be obvious what the quarter notes are (because a song wouldn't be 30bpm)...

      but sometimes I'm not too sure if what I'm counting as the quarter notes would actually be 8th notes or vice versa.

10.20.18  8:23 pm   How can I learn transcribing/notating music correctly? There are probably hundreds of different ways to notate something in music and they could all still sound the same when executed correctly. Without having another person to look at my transcription, how do I know if I did a good job transcribing it the easiest/most efficient/most legible way possible? Do I just have to read a lot of scores until I sort of get it?
